tracks.topDesc: A beautiful, subtlely-progressive track that grows into something magnificent from one of Ireland's best indie rock bands.
tracks.mainDesc: One of my favourite tracks of the year, from its beautiful start to its powerful buildup and breathtaking ending.

tracks.topDesc: A raw, emotional acoustic track from Cavan singer-songwriter James Bentley's debut EP.
tracks.mainDesc: From the eerie beginning, to the towering chrous that slowly builds into a very powerful ending, this track is definitely one to check out.

tracks.topDesc: The Irish hip-hop scene has seen a resurgence lately, breaking into the mainstream with increasingly high festival-billings and a larger audience than ever.
tracks.mainDesc: But one artist stands out amongst the rest - Kojaque. I first discovered Kojaque through his viral hit "Midnight Flower", but it was with his 2018 project "Deli Daydreams" that he cemented himself in the scene as the most creative and talented hip-hop artist in the country. "Deli Daydreams" was one of my favourite projects of the year, and "Date Night" seems like the perfect follow-up. To me it nearly feels like a victory lap, with both Kojaque and Luka Palm dripping with confidence after their new-found success. Kojaque's flow is completely flawless, and sounds like an absolute pro. Luka Palm weaves in and around Kojaque throughout the track and is a great addition. Kean Kavanagh's production is great with a commanding bassline and a late switch-up, which Kojaque rides perfectly. With a track like this, I can't wait to see what Soft Boy Records come out with next.

tracks.topDesc: A dreamy indie pop track from the Belfast band's upcoming 7th album.
The latest track from one of Ireland's best live acts, starting slow and vulnerable before bursting into a powerful chorus.
tracks.mainDesc: Their debut album "Shape Of Silence" will be released on October 5th.

tracks.songName: You're Looking a Little Rough Around the Edges
tracks.topDesc: A strong debut single from the instrumental West Ireland band, with both delicate and thunderous moments (but, let's be honest, more thunderous than anything else)
A breathtaking track, featuring beautiful vocals from Bell X1's Paul Noonan, that sounds like nothing I've heard all year
The latest track from Dublin singer-songwriter Soulé is an infectious pop hit.
tracks.mainDesc: To be completely honest, Soulé is an artist who has never really captured me, but this new track is the perfect mix of lyrical emotion and a chorus you can't help but dance to. This track deserves to take over the Irish airwaves.

tracks.topDesc: Infectious punk-tinted pop-rock from the talented Derry-based artist
tracks.mainDesc: I hadn't heard of Susie Blue before about a week ago, but I've started going through her back catalogue these last few days. Her sound isn't overly complicated and reminds me of the 90s/early 00s sound, but everything is executed really well. This track is a really catchy one, I always find it stuck in my head when I least expect. Sidenote: the amount of great music from the Derry/Donegal region is crazy.

tracks.topDesc: One of the most funky and fun Irish tracks I've heard
tracks.mainDesc: I love this track a lot. Conor Clancy's vocals are incredibly smooth and the instrumentation is flawless, the production is clean. That "Like a hot knife through butter" line just sounds incredibly good, especially just as the drums come back in. It's definitely worth checking out their EP "TOUCAN", which is out now.
